summary:
This mod gives you a new uniqe set of Ancient Nord Armor, that was used by Yngol and can be found in Yngols Barrow inside a Chest.

Coral Claw required!
descriptionHtml:
Armor of Yngol
Version: 1.0
Date: 10.06.2013
Category: Armour
Authors: Luddemann, Witcher5688 and Cabal120
Source: /mods/37070

This is a Nexus Exclusive Mod, don't reupload it anywhere!

Also included in skyrim immersive creatures by lifestorock.
Pls give him an endorse-me, he realy deserve it! Link Is on the bottom of this Page.
[url=http://www.directupload.net][img]http://s1.directupload.net/images/130610/wrkcc5ke.jpg[/img][/url]
[youtube]PKLfPqTTxjM[/youtube] [youtube]fiV7fKLTrIA[/youtube]
[youtube]VeCGLudFLYg[/youtube] [youtube]IfRBkpsSNLE[/youtube]

1. Introduction
2. Crafting/Location
3. Credits
4. future
5.Permissions
6. about Yngol/Lore
7. Translations
8. recomended

1.Introduction
This mod gives you a complete new Armor set of the Ancient Nords.
its fully temperable, uniqe and can be found with yngols helmet on yngols barrow.
The Coral Dragonclaw is required!

2.Tempering and Location
Yngols Barrow, east to Windhelm
[url=http://www.directupload.net][img]http://s14.directupload.net/images/130610/vk5jgaxr.jpg[/img][/url]

You can't create it on a forge, its only temperable on a workbench.


3.Credits
Luddemann: 3d Design and some Texture work
Cabal120: Creating special AMB Textures for this mod
Witcher5688: CreationKit Work
lifestorock: Female Armor and Male Shirt fix
feenixfly: Screenshots
Brodual: Video
Hodilton: Video
misalen: Video
Saiodin: Video

4.future
Atm this Armor has normal textures, if you have AMB textures installed they'll appear on the armor.
on the next updates, the new textures will be added if Witcher has the time to do it.

5.Permissions
There was a Problem with a translation where the Author uploaded the complete Mod wich wasn't allowed under any circumstances.
He has broke my notes/rules so you MUST ask for permissions First for everything you want to use from this Mod!

Translation: ESP only, ask for permissions First!
Using for armor compilations: i'll agree but ask before Using!
Reupload on steam: don't ask, i won't agree and don't want To See one of my Mods there.
Reupload on other communitys: ask for permissions First! Eventually yes, eventually no.

6.Lore

elderscrolls.wikia.com/wiki/Yngol

Yngols History:
"Yngol was the eldest son of the legendary Ysgramor, he also had a younger brother, Ylgar. Yngol as well as his brother were said to have been taken to Tamriel with Ysgramor as he tried to flee from the civil war on Atmora.
Along with other settlers, Yngol and his family were inhabitants of the Saarthal and was there during the elven raid, Night of Tears. Yngol is said to be among the three survivors. He, along with Ysgramor and Ylgar, fled back to Atmora.
After returning to Atmora, Yngol was already known as a bold strategist, his knowledge of war so complete that his enemies were often defeated before they realized the battle had begun.
Yngol joined his father's cause to avenge the fallen brothers and sisters and joined the Five Hundred Companions. Ysgramor made sure both brothers had ships under their command, thus Yngol became the captain of Harakk. Along with everyone else, Yngol and Ylgar sailed out of the massive shipyards of Jylkurfyk, not knowing that this was the last time they would meet.During the voyage to Mereth, the fleet of the Five Hundred was hit by the Storm of Separation. Both of the brothers were separated from the rest of the crew but only the youngest brother, Ylgar, sailed out of it alive. Yngol never landed at Hsaarik Head along with the rest of the fleet.
Ysgramor was said to be enraged by this event. He shouted at the sea, demanding for them to return his son to him. Ysgramor set sail into the storm alone, but failed to save Yngol. By the time Ysgramor found the shipwreck of Harakk, Yngol and his crewmen had already been slain by the sea-ghosts. Yngol was first among the many brothers to fall during the Return.

Ysgramor is said to have hunted the beasts down and burned their corpses in honor of his fallen son. Yngol was buried in Atmorian fashion, there was a barrow made for him.

After reclaiming Saarthal, Ysgramor returned to Yngol Barrow and built the great city - Windhelm. It was built where the nearby river met the sea, close enough so that Ysgramor may see his son's resting place from the high towers of the palace.
Yngol Barrow still stood in Fourth Era and during the events of The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim. Upon entering the throne room of the Yngol Barrow, the Dragonborn is attacked by a ghostly image of Yngol's corpse called Yngol's Shade. On the throne by Yngol's corpse lies Helm of Yngol, a unique helm."
